name: Mexican Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
description: These Mexican stuffed sweet potatoes make such a great dinner for the whole family. They're super healthy, comforting, entirely vegan, and you need only 15 minutes of active preparation time!
recipeIngredient: 2 cups cherry tomatoes, cut into halves
1 cup bell pepper, cut into medium-sized pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oven to 350 °F. Use a fork to poke small holes in the sweet potatoes (all the way round).
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the oven to 350 °F. Use a fork to poke small holes in the sweet potatoes (all the way round).

recipeInstructions.text: Line a baking tray with parchment paper. Use a silicone pastry brush to lightly oil the sweet potatoes with olive oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a baking tray with parchment paper. Use a silicone pastry brush to lightly oil the sweet potatoes with olive oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 40-60 minutes (depending on the size of the sweet potatoes). Use a tooth pick to check if they are tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 40-60 minutes (depending on the size of the sweet potatoes). Use a tooth pick to check if they are tender.

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse and drain the black beans and the corn. Cut the bell pepper into medium-sized pieces. Finely chop the cilantro. Chop the red onion.
recipeInstructions.name: Rinse and drain the black beans and the corn. Cut the bell pepper into medium-sized pieces. Finely chop the cilantro. Chop the red onion.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the cherry tomatoes into halves. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the cherry tomatoes into halves. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the dressing: Combine all ingredients in a small bowl and stir until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the dressing: Combine all ingredients in a small bowl and stir until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the dressing over the vegetables and beans and stir well.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour the dressing over the vegetables and beans and stir well.

recipeInstructions.text: When the sweet potatoes are tender, take them out of the oven and let them cool down a bit for about 5 minutes. Then slice in half lengthwise. Use a fork to mash some of the inside of the sweet potatoes to make space for the filling.
recipeInstructions.name: When the sweet potatoes are tender, take them out of the oven and let them cool down a bit for about 5 minutes. Then slice in half lengthwise. Use a fork to mash some of the inside of the sweet potatoes to make space for the filling.

recipeInstructions.text: Equally divide the filling between the sweet potatoes. Add a large tablespoon of guacamole on top and sprinkle it with freshly chopped cilantro and red pepper flakes. Drizzle with fresh lime juice.
